div1.p: [Carter] comments on the efficacy of the yellow fever vaccine.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Hideyo Noguchi, November 21, 1921

opener.dateline:
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.,
November 21, 1921.

div1.p:
I have just returned from the meeting of the Malaria Confer-
ence at Hot Springs, Arkansas, and find your letter of November
15th. awaiting me. I am enclosing a carbon of a letter to my
publishers, asking that certain additions be made to the article, o
of which I sent you the carbon. These, as you see, express strong-
ly my belief in the efficacy of preventative vaccination in Tuxpan.
You need not have underscored your last paragraph. Had I known of
the results at Tuxpan and Guayaquil I would have been well satis-
fied with vaccination alone where it could have been thoroughly
done.
With highest regards and best wishes, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Dr. Hideyo Noguchi,
Rockefeller Institute of Medical Research,
66th. Street and Avenue A.,
New York, N. Y.
